Social Security.definition: the principle or practice or a program of public provision

1.definition: the principle or practice or a program of public provision (as through social insurance or assistance) for the economic security and social welfare of the individual and his or her familya U.S. government program established in 1935 to include old-age and survivors insurance, contributions to state unemployment insurance, and old-age assistance

2.definition: money paid out through a social security program [collects] see alsoin the Important Laws sectionin the Important Agencies section
